Deaths from the COVID-19 epidemic in Italy have climbed by 333 against 260 the day before, the Civil Protection Agency says, but the daily tally of new cases declined to 1739 from 2324 on Sunday, posting the lowest reading since March 10.

articles.title: Research doubles understanding of what causes melanoma - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Researchers have discovered 33 more regions of the genome that raises the risk of getting melanoma, giving greater insight into the causes of the deadly cancer.

"So its going through the entire genome at once and trying to figure out which regions are present more often in people with the disease than without."
